repository.corpname: M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections & Archives

did.unittitle: Hawley Saddle and Harness Shop Records
did.abstract: This collection consist of records from the proprietors of a saddle and harness making shop in Paris, New York.
did.physloc: The materials are located onsite in the department.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Stephen Conant, 1803-1806, and then Ezekiel Hawley, 1830-1846, were the proprietors of a saddle and harness making shop in Paris, New York.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of account books kept by Stephen Conant and Ezekiel Hawley as proprietors of a saddle and harness making shop in Paris, New York.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: All items in this manuscript group were transferred to the University Libraries, M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted because it is unprocessed. While it is likely that portions of the collection may be viewed, access must be managed by an archivist.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: The researcher assumes full responsibility for conforming with the laws of copyright. Whenever possible, the M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives will provide information about copyright owners and other restrictions, but the legal determination ultimately rests with the researcher. Requests for permission to publish material from this collection should be discussed with the Head of Special Collections and Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows: Hawley Saddle and Harness Shop Records. M.E. Grenander Department of Special Collections and Archives, University Libraries, University at Albany, State University of New York (hereafter referred to as the Hawley Saddle and Harness Shop Records).

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The collection was purchased from a dealer in 1970.
